Dictionary.description: -- Definition -- Function of a WaterwayNode in the water transport network.

Definition.description:
-- Definition -- Infrastructure elements where the one vessel traffic flow crosses another vessel traffic flow or points where vessel traffic flows divide or come together.
-- Description -- SOURCE [COMPRIS].
Definition.name: junctionFork

Definition.description: -- Definition -- Lock or group of locks, intended for raising and lowering boats between stretches of water of different levels on river and canal waterways.
Definition.name: lockComplex

Definition.description: -- Definition -- Bridge that can be raised or turned to allow the passage of ships.
Definition.name: movableBridge

Definition.description:
-- Definition -- The location where goods are transhipped.
-- Description -- SOURCE [COMPRIS].
NOTE A terminal forms a link between the various transport modes, of which shipping is one. A terminal therefore has waterside loading and unloading places [COMPRIS].
Definition.name: terminal

Definition.description: -- Definition -- A place where a canal or narrow waterway is widened to allow boats to turn around.
Definition.name: turningBasin

Definition.description:
-- Definition -- A machine for transporting boats between water bodies at two different elevations, which is used as an alternative to the canal locks..
-- Description -- NOTE Synonyms: boat lift, lift lock.
Definition.name: shipLift
